hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed a total of 4 nights after a terrible hotel experience elsewhere, it was nice to be instantly be welcomed by hotel staff. They were friendly and accomodating. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and cleanly kept. The rooms were larger (for NYC) than we expected, very modern chic decor. Although all staff was wonderful, we have to praise Sonam who provided exceptional service. If you have any issues or questions about your stay, he's a great resource for any guests. The location is so close to Central Park and really everything else, most definately coming back!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Very nice hotel indeed! Beautiful NYC view.Hotel personnel was very kind and helpful. Interior decoration is very nice. Very nice spot! Execellent service.Rooms are very clean. Price is fine. Heating is OK.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: While the rooms are nice, cozy and in line with most of the NY hotels in this category (I've tried a lot of them), the high point of this property is the people. The front desk welcome, the doorman, the housekeeper, and overall tone of the people in the property was uniquely positive and made the stay feel like home. I haven't seen that with many NY hotels I've used in the past few years. The concierge was especially helpful when I needed to leave early and was unable to return to NYC. He helped pack up my things and ship my luggage to my home, since I wasn't able to return to the city. Chris Carrow was very willing to help in an unusual way, it would have been easy to say "NO". He went the extra mile to help me out. This is my first trip adviser review, but it's also the first time that I've had service that deserves a public positive note.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently celebrated my fiancé’s birthday at le Meridien Central Park. The property is in a great location but it was the service that made our stay so great. Melissa gave us a great Central Park view and facilitated a birthday amenity on check in.Vijay was very friendly and helpful regarding our check out time. Sonom was the shining star when we extended our stay an extra night. He truly went above and beyond the call of duty in making us feel welcome and making the birthday extra special.These three are all assets to the hospitality industry and deserve to be highly acknowledged as leaders in the field.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I love the hotel, but what makes it a true wonderful experience is when your first interaction at the front desk sets the tone for the entire experience. Sonam remembered me from last stay months ago and made sure that I had the best available room and that all of my needs for the stay were taken care of including taking care of booking me an additional night the next day at the best available rate. Every employee that I came into contact with was terrific but Sonam was amazing and he is the reason that I will choose Le Meridien again when I come back in a few weeks.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: This was my second stay within a couple of months, and I will choose Le Meridien again soon! Comfy, cozy rooms and staff who treat us like old friends, plus a million-dollar view? What’s not to love? Can’t wait to come back!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Very well run hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Especially VJ at the front desk and Raphael at the door. Thank you guys for going above and beyond during my stay. For business travelers that need to stay in the city, the location is great and you’ll be walking distance to the park. Pro tip: start your day with the breakfast buffet at the restaurant downstairs.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Stay was pleasant, everything was nicr, all good. Raphael was very helpful and professional. HE offered help anytime needed. Stuff is great and friendly and the lobby looks amazaing. They have a good gym too.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the La Meridien in January this year (2020). With so many choices in NYC it was a pleasant surprise to not only find a hotel in a great location, but one where the staff and general service was second to none. Room and lobby cleanliness, appearance and decor was great. We would definitely return without hesitation. R&N

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Staff goes out of their way to help and location is great. I left something behind and staff quickly helped me resolve the issue. Stylish rooms but on the small side. Gym isn’t big but it has most of the basic equipment

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I booked my stay through Marriot. I requested an early arrival which was accommodated by the hotel. The front desk allowed a late check out as well which really helped me accomplish my tasks in New York City. The hotel is very centrally located and close to a lot of famous landmarks. My room was clean and quiet. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Check in ok; got into narrow crowded elevator; found floor which was very dark.Room was very dated and looked in need of refurbishment. No money has been spent at hotel in several years. Wood paneling faded and scratched. Roof top bar was dirty and furniture was old. Would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Our stay at Le Meridien was absolutely fantastic. Upon check in, we were upgraded to a terrace room with a lovely view of 57th street. Then, we were given a great welcome basket of fresh fruit and premium still water bottles. (side note, they have free spring water bottles at the front desk, so take advantage of that-especially since water bottles come at a premium usually in hotels). To top off our great stay, they brought up two free beers. Don't forget about the traveler appreciation happy hour from 5-7 where they will have free glasses of wine and beer. I've seen a few comments about the furnishings, and while they are a little dated, they are classic mid-century pieces that are solid, clean pieces. They may have a little wear from over the years, but nothing was in disrepair. The bathroom was fully modern and upgraded, and the bed was new, comfortable, and fresh. Finally, Chris was very kind and checked in to ensure that we enjoyed our stay and was responsible for all the personal touches I've mentioned. My wife and I will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I had a wonderful stay at this property.Honestly, the hotel rooms could use a furniture upgrade but the service and staff at this hotel were exemplary. Everyone from manager , check in , maintenance and the bell staff were excellent and helpful. The bed was also comfortable and clean. The staff at breakfast was also friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: The location could not be more perfect. The room is very modern with beautiful finishes. Most of all, Vijay, the host at the front desk went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable - something one is lucky to get in NY. I was so thankful to him and hope his Organization recognises his passion for his work.
user_name:
Bigmovement
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Loved this Hotel and the Location ...could walk to all our favorite sites in NYC... !! Front desk staff was awesome and helped celebrated my daughter’s Birthday, one that she will always remember.... Front desk staff all wonderful ... Flitta is the best...loved the view of Central Park....❤️❤️

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed for 5 days this February and everything was pretty good, great location near CP and subways, clean rooms and comfy beds.The staff is really amazing, we are brazilians and Raphael one of the doormans help us with everything we needed!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is so nice, so clean, with a perfect location close to the 5th avenue and in front of Central Park. The staff is so friendly and so professional.Special thanks to Sonam and Vije for their kind attention.I will return to this hotel

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: This morning I reached out to the Concierge Dana S - my request was to send a special Valentine to my brother and his wife from their three pets who were being boarded while their parents visited NYC. An odd request but one that was welcomed and carried out flawlessly from Concierge Dana S and his Concierge Christopher C. Gentlemen - thank you for being so nice to work with on behalf on myself & three well-wishing pets who love their Mom & Dad. Your efforts have earned you a guest for life!Thanks again.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Sorry to say, I would not stay here again. The location is very, very good. We stayed just after Christmas for a couple of nights. Easily walkable to midtown attractions and shopping and the park. The hotel was completely average. Of course, it was small because of NYC, but the space in the rooms was not used wisely and they could be updated. The walls were thin and we could hear people in the hallway like they were in our rooms. The staff was friendly to a bare minimum.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I’ve been visiting NY city for the last 20 years, i have to say that this hotel offers the best service in the city, the staff are nice and welcoming , they make you feel at home especially Vijay who loves his job and always willing to help and offer you a better service.I strongly recommend this hotel, ask for Vijay and i’m sure you will get the best service in the city.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: On 57th street near Columbus Circle and a few blocks from Central ParK. Staff very friendly and efficient. Has a great Rooftop bar with view of Central Park. Currently onsite restaurant is only serving breakfast. Rooms are somewhat dated with nautica/cruise feel, but tentatively scheduled for renovation in 2020. But all in all very comfortable and wonderful location.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I stay in this hotel about 4 times a year and every single time, I feel extremely comfortable. The hotel room is fine but what sets this hotel apart from the other hotels in the city is the excellent staff. Everyone is genuinely friendly, not automatic robot friendliness. They are so helpful and very attentive, especially VIJAY. He's the best. Someone needs to make this guy the manager if he is not already. If you go there, ask for him, he will definitely take the best care of you.
user_name:
BaeDesigns
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Perfect stay. Room was very clean and comfortable. It is iron how in such a busy city we were able to rest so peacefully in a very quiet room. The location of the hotel was just perfect with many options for dining at a walking distance. Staff was very helpful and they provided friendly customer service.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I had the pleasure of being a guest here and being taken care of my a guest services rep named Sonam who really made this hotel spectacular. The rest of the guest services crew was great, too, but Sonam was exceptional.The room was smaller but modern and well designed. Mid century modern with some twists is how I would call it.Location was great - a few blocks from Central Park and the subway and not TOO close to the chaos of Times Square!I would stay here again based on the service.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: When a weekend in New York went horribly wrong, thanks to a pre-paid reservation at what turned out to be a fleabag hotel, a friend and I fled in desperation to the nearby Le Meridien. Thank GOODNESS we did! Louie at the front desk couldn't have been nicer, waving his magic wand and placing us in a comfortable, quiet, spotless room (sleek midcentury-Mad Men-meets-vintage-New-York decor, marble bathroom and all) that rescued the rest of the weekend and sent us off on a high note. His fellow staff members were equally charming. Looking forward to a return visit next time I'm in New York!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Our trip was excellent! As per the Le Meridien it was breathtaking, beautiful view, excellent service, friendly staff that were willing to help. It was our 28th wedding anniversary and just by choosing the Le Meridien services, help location where everything is centrally located made us felt like it was our 1st anniversary horse-draw carriage OMG.
user_name:
stacy d
Port Saint Lucie, Florida

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Typical Le Meridien Hotel. Good Service. Smaller Rooms, Very Helpful Front desk and Concierge. Always ready to help. Sonam Vijay Dana Chris were exceptionally good. Sonam takes the cake. The hotel is walking distance from Central Park Times Square , Columbis circle, Underground Station , Broadway, Trump Tower etc

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: This is actually my first review ever but had to warn people not to stay at this hotel. I travel all the time and am a Marriott titanium elite member - not that this hotel cares. First off, thought I had booked Le Parker Méridien but it appears that in 2019 that it was bought by Hyatt and the le meridian moved next door into a hole in the wall building. There is basically no lobby, no lobby ba, no nothing. The staff isn’t rude but they are insanely clueless and inattentive. I booked a one bedroom suite. The size of the room is the only nice thing I can say about this place. You can hear people showering when you are in the nasty hallway. The windows are so sold that it was like sleeping outdoors it was so cold. They gave me two Rinky dinky towels for the entire suite. Had nothing to dry off with in the morning. Most annoying thing was when I took the time to go through the room service menu to order breakfast and called down to order, they told me that menu doesn’t exist anymore and I had a selection of a muffin or a muffin. They told me it was because the restaurant is beiMy renovated. So I went downstairs and the restaurant is fully open. I asked if I could get breakfast to go for my room and they said no, it was 35 dollar buffet. No thanks. Went across street to get breakfast sandwich at a deli. Normally the front desk always asks how your stay was when you check out but I can see why this front desk didn’t ask.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We loved Le Meridien New York Central Park! Everyone was so helpful and accommodating. They went above and beyond especially Sharam and Luigi helping us find the right room and wonderful restaurants! We definitely will be back!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Came into the city for the weekend to see the sites and 911 memorial. Hotel is very nice, clean room and bathroom. Very comfortable and a great location. Staff very friendly and accommodating. The rooftop lounge is great. Can’t wait to come back again. Thank you.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: First time we tried this place-we take several trips to NYC throughout the year. Easy walk to the theaters-frindly service when we checked in. Our upgraded room was a bit dated. We checked in Friday checked out Sunday-very strangely our room was not serviced at all during our stay-no bed making or anything-just Odd. We left the room for the early ice skating and afternoon Broadway show on Saturday-went to dinner and visited with family to return late Saturday night to find the same unmade beds that we left in the morning. Nice location we could walk to everything-like I said really wanted to like it

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Loved our stay at Le Meridien central park. Of course, the location is perfect with a short walk to central park and a 15 minute walk to Times Square.The hotel room was very well decorated with an elegant feel. I wish I could have stayed there longer.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Hotel is within 5 mins walk to Central Park, 5th Avenue, metro station. And within 10 mins walk to Rockefeller centre and many other tourist spots.Room is clean and everything is well maintained. Front desk team is friendly and helpful. No complaints at all.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Very nice hotel. Staff were super friendly. Rooms were spacious by Manhattan standards. Our room had a very nice roomy shower. No ice machines so you have to ask at the bar if you want ice for the room. Overall highly recommended.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: SLet me preface everything with the fact that up until summer 2019, this property was branded as The Viceroy, so there is still an ongoing transition to bring this up to the standard of Le Méridien. As it stands in January 2020, the property is definitely not at Le Méridien’s standards. However, I will absolutely return to this property when I am in New York.What makes this property incredible: The PeopleEvery interaction that I had, from check-in, to getting acquainted, lobby staff interactions, bar / restaurant staff - the people are incredible. I felt like a valuable family member the entire time I was there, and that is the top memory that I carry from my first stay at this property.The estheticsKnowing that the complete renovation is imminent, my opinions are very lenient on this point. The hard product is very worn, dark, and not at all what you expect from a Le Méridien property. This will change, so give it a chance. Right now, the rooms feel awkward, dark, but still everything is very comfortable and I will stay here again even before renovations. Remember, this is New York City, spaces can be cramped so don’t expect a bathroom the size of one that you might find in Atlanta or Miami for example. The lobby has already been renovated so it is very warm and comfortable when you arrive, especially on those chilly and brisk New York winter days. Two elevators serve the 29 floors so waiting for a lift is very quick.If you’re staying here before the renovation - yes the rooms feel dark, the surfaces feel worn and old, but this will change soon.Food & BeverageThis was the biggest weakness for the Le Méridien brand. Please note - I did not experience room service (maybe I should have, perhaps next time).The restaurant off the lobby on the ground floor is called Kingside. As of January 2019 this restaurant is only available for breakfast. So I have not had a chance to try this space. Even being in the middle of Midtown New York, we need a full service restaurant at this property.On the 29th floor, there is a very charming bar called Rooftop, and part of it is indoors and outdoors (during my stay the outdoor section was covered, and had heat lamps). This is where I had my worst, most non-Le Méridien experience.Again I say, the people at Rooftop are incredible, very accommodating and warm. I learned my first night that the food & beverage management company had just recently changed, and here is the new menu. Two nights later, nothing on that menu is available. Instead, a very limited selection of food is offered (eg., olives, cheese & crackers, French fries, salmon toast), all which are very expensive. I ordered the cheese & crackers and the French fries which were completely unacceptable. The fries were soggy and limp, the cheese was served walk-in cold and just not good. I did have a very positive conversation with Juan, who rectified my invoice, and was very open to my feedback. I hope that the next time, there is an improvement.Overall : B-Room: BFood & Bev: D+

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We spent a few post-New Year's days in NYC and stayed at Le Meridien. During our visit, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Definitely beyond what I usually get at a NYC hotel. For example, the concierge happily printed my theater tickets when I realized I couldn't use a mobile option. The location was great - easy walking distance to Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square. Rooms were clean and comfortable, with just the right Art Deco touches. After we left, my daughter realized she left a small bag with medicine in her hotel room. When I called, the staff said they would contact security for me. I didn't hold out much hope - it had been two days. But they called back to tell me that they located the bag and would send it to me. I have left items before in rooms and never gotten this level of service and attention to detail (and, yes, we will be doing a better job checking our rooms going foward!).

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Booked this hotel due to location and Le Meridien brand reputation. We were disappointed. The pros are few: friendly staff and great location. The cons were the hotel itself and the breakfast. The hotel is outdated, dark, rundown, and needs renovation badly. See the photos. It is like someone’s den from the 70’s with old furniture and outdated lighting that is not bright at all and makes the room feel cave-like. There is ugly brown carpet and stained wood furniture (I attached just one photo of the stained/marked furniture, but took more than that). The desk is literally bolted to the floor. The light fixtures are awful and provide little light. The hallways are dark and dreary and look like a cheap hotel. I have stayed in hotels in lower categories and had much nicer rooms and decor. It is worth mentioning that the photos on the Marriott website, where I booked, made the rooms look light and bright. They are not.We booked a 1 bedroom suite with Central Park view. Not sure what room Marriott took the central park view picture from, but we were on the 22nd floor and had the view in the photo attached. There are 27 floors and I don’t see how going up five floors higher or to the left or right gets the unobstructed view shown in Marriott’s photo on their website. (it was very foggy the day I took the photo, so not the best shot, but you can see that the view is buildings with Central Park visible beyond.) We are Marriott members so had a special rate that included breakfast. I would not recommend spending extra for the breakfast. The cost of it is $35 per person and $15 for a child. It is a buffet, so chafing dishes of scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, and sausage. Also cold cereals, bagels, bread to toast, fruit, and yogurt with granola. Juice and coffee included. Does it sound almost exactly like a free breakfast at a Residence Inn? It is almost the same in selection and quality, but $35 per person. Our rate to have breakfast included was $40 or $50 more versus a room rate without breakfast (can’t recall exactly), so we weren’t actually paying the $35 per person, but the breakfast was not worth the extra money. Really disappointing considering we could have gone to a restaurant and had much better breakfast for less than what we paid. In sum, we would not stay here again and would t recommend to friends. Marriott really needs to spend some money here!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our experience staying at Le Meridien Central Park. As the name implies it is right next to the park, and walking distance from Times Square, Theatre district, shopping and so forth. We took no cabs but walked everywhere during our stay. The hotel is small but very charming and cozy, and every staff member we interacted with was welcoming and helpful. For instance, the concierge, Dana Steer, provided excellent information about the theater offerings so we were able to book seats to a great production with little advance notice. He was very skillful at managing a number of calls and requests while we were working with him, all the while ensuring our needs were addressed. We'll be returning to this hotel!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Well, if you are going to stay here, expect the staff to be nothing but genuinely helpful.Brian, Dana and Charisma were so good to us, it made our stay that much more pleasurable.The rooms are very nice and well maintained. Location is A+. Bring our first time to New York, staying here made it so easy to get around and we were so close to time square, 5th Avenue and Central Park. We would like to thank the team at Le Meridien, and to anyone thinking about booking here, don’t think about it, it’s a must.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: You can't beat the location at this hotel or the roof top bar and lounge which is fabulous. The rooms are dated and the furnishings are worn and stained. The hallways are very drab and worn. We had a junior one bedroom suite which was a great size. The bathrooms are very nice and in good shape and large. The service was good, very friendly. The lobby is small and crowded so don't plan on hanging out there. I am shocked this was a Viceory up until a few months ago, the condition of this hotel is not what I consider up to Viceroy standards. This hotel is now owned by Marriott and they shgould consider a renovation given the great location. We used to go to the Parker Meriden next store which is awesome and is now called The Parker and owned by Hyatt.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at Le Meridien at Xmas time as part of a package deal including flights to and from the Netherlands. The hotel is very conveniently situated in midtown Manhattan and close to several subway stations and Central Park.Our room was not very large but adequate to our (2 persons) needs. The interior design is charming with wrought-iron mirrors, messing rain-shower, nice tiling. Charming little Illy coffee machine with complimentary coffee capsules. As our neighbour was very noisy and clearly very drunk, shouting aggressively, we did not get a lot of sleep the first night, but the staff reacted to this promptly and adequately by sending someone up to deal with the matter. The next day we were allocated to another room, the staff being solution focussed, Our luggage was relocated while we were roaming NYC.Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean; we had a nice view from the 19th floor.As we did not eat in the hotel, I cannot comment on that, There is a nice bar on the top floor with a great view. As anywhere else in NYC, the bar was very expensive ( a beer for $9, glass of wine $12, small platter of nachos chips with small bowl of (good) guacamole $22). Prices in NYC are through the roof and this may make us rethink a future visit, but we would recommend Le Meridien to anybody who is planning to visit Manhattan.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I chose LeMeridian from past experience traveling. I expected more attention to detail. Room although extremely convenient to Central Park I was met by a large hairball in the shower. If they say it was recently updated...well keep updating. The room was dark,and terribly dated. The room cleaning staff needs more supervision or training. Shower and wash basin drains plugs missing or broken and towel hanger was too far from the shower. Small details matter but only 2 stars. The toilet paper end was folded everyday. Price and convenience were about right for the area.
user_location: Palma de Mallorca, Islas Baleares, Spain
user_name:
668donaldl
Palma de Mallorca, Islas Baleares, Spain

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: This was the first time I stayed at Le Meridien. Everything about this place is "top shelf" from when I was first greeted at check-in until I checked out. The staff is extremely welcoming. Everyone who works here is extremely gracious no matter what their job is. My room was fabulous and had a view of Central Park. I was here to celebrate my birthday. Staying here was my birthday gift to me. I think this has to be one of the best gifts I have ever given myself and I'm looking forward to my next stay. The king size bed was ultra comfortable and the bathroom was perfect. I was "Queen for a Weekend". Room service was excellent. No complaints but many thanks to a superb staff.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Work requires me to be in NYC (near Columbus Circle) every year during the second week of December. And while that part of town is charming around the holidays, the surge pricing of hotels rooms is anything but... In the past years I've stayed at The London NYC, but since its being renovated, I was looking for something similar, in the same price range: homey, not corporate, charming and high-end. From the website, Le Meridian seemed comparable, so I booked a room there for this year's trip and was totally disappointed. Knowing we'd be arriving after midnight, I made sure there was a note in our reservation to hold our room and called twice beforehand to ensure it would be. Of course, when we arrived at 1:30AM, our room had been given away and the only room available was the last one in the hotel - room 203 - which is unfit for guests. It has two double beds (not queens) with ill-fitting sheets, no furniture, no alarm clock, no remote and hadn't been cleaned. Ugh. Just to add insult to injury, the people at the desk tried to convince me that this room was actually an upgrade (!!!) and charged $799 for the night ($200 more than the king room we had booked). They knew they were putting lipstick on a pig. We were moved to a king on a higher floor the next day. And while that room was fine, it was tiny and the compressor for the heater kept having to be reset, so it was freezing. The staff is friendly. The lobby is lovely. The Roof was closed for private parties every night we were there (second week of December, so understandable). It's very convenient to where I have to be for work meetings. The Art Deco vibe is charming in the common areas and maybe in the larger guest rooms, but the rooms we stayed in were old and dinky. Next time I will stay at the Parker or the Park Central, which have more updated rooms and are a much better value.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: spent countless hours trying to figure out my hotel stay in NYC. WOW, I'm so happy that my search is over and I found my home away from home. The staff is very courteous, professional and best of all, attentive. They know how to run the place seamlessly, even through the most hectic days of Thanksgiving weekend.I have to give a special shout out to Sonam Chosgial because he went above and beyond to provide 5 star customer service to me and my husband, which was deeply appreciated.  If you're staying during Thanksgiving, this location has a very nice spot next to the Macy's parade route. Also, please do not leave without having a drink at The Roof with sweeping views of Central Park. The bartender makes great martinis and he's easy on the eyes. Stop looking around and book this hotel! perfect location too!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights, rooms weren’t ready when we arrived in the afternoon but we were told we’d get an upgrade for being Marriott Bonvoy members, we went for a drink in the Kingside bar until they were ready. When we were given the rooms they were quite small and no view of Central Park, not sure what the rooms were like before the upgrade?!They were clean but certainly ready for an update, not much storage space as one cupboard had the fridge and coffee machine in. The towels and bedding were changed daily and the beds/pillows were really comfortable. We didn’t get to see the rooftop bar as there was a private party on the evening we decided to go so tried the Kingside bar which was also closed for a private party, the reception staff weren’t aware of this initially so there were no signs up telling the guests, lack of communication between staff??The door staff were really friendly and helpful and arranged a taxi for the airport for our journey home.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I felt welcome before we ever stepped foot inside. Everyone was friendly, helpful and courteous. Room was not large, but perfect for my husband and me. Very comfortable and updated. One drawback... no microwave and we didn’t see an ice machine. There is a grocery store next to hotel so that was great!Location was absolutely perfect for our plans... Carnegie Hall almost next door and St. Patrick’s Cathedral and Rockefeller Center an easy walk. Central Park just a few blocks. Great restaurants only feet away. This was our first trip to NYC and, if returning, we would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in the le meridien and we had an amazing time. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The hotel is very quiet in our room and street is quiet. we were not charged a hotel tax when leaving and the bars are cashless so you will need a card to check in and to pay the room bill. It is 2 blocks away from central park and the plaza hotel shown in home alone film. Its about a 15 min walk to times square/broadway. About 20 mins for Bloomingdales and 15mins to the Rockefeller centre and Saks. The subway station is at the end of the block on both sides which we used to get about town and used the train/subway to get from the airport. We used park cafe for breakfast is was really filling and reasonable priced.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Nice hotel with great location. We had a suite, one bedroom and a living room. Nice bathroom. Gym facilities also good. Breakfast not worthe the price. Efficient check-in. The staff is nice and welcoming. We adressed a few problems in our room and tey were fixed imediately.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I am a pretty loyal Marriott girl so I wanted the reviews to be wrong. But some of the issues other people mentioned I experienced as well. I’m not sure what exactly the issue was. When I checked in, the guy said it said on my account that it was my birthday ( it wasn’t) and they would send me a present. I explained that it wasn’t my birthday but he said they would do it anyway, that they would send a bottle of Prosecco to the room and asked which day I would want it. I gave a day. It was never received, which is fine, but I don’t think hotel staff should make claims and not follow through. I also had SEVERAL issues with bell services. I checked in very early morning and had to store our luggage until our room was ready but the man at the desk tried to page them on a walkie talkie to come get the bags and they never came or responded. He had to send another staff member to get someone. We also never received any sort of notification that our room was ready that day. We came back late at night after being out all day. As I was at the front desk again collecting keys he tried to page bell services to retrieve our bags and they never responded. So I left the claim ticket and they said they would deliver them to the room. This was after midnight. It took over 30 minutes to deliver the luggage. I am not a complainer but I had to call the desk to ask about them because we needed them before we could go to sleep. The location of the hotel is great, atmosphere good, no complaints with housekeeping, but I can’t say if I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Got a good rate from a website and loved the location. Burgers at the lobby are also very good. Everything is nearby - including Central Park. Broadway shows are even walkable. The bathrooms are cute and bed quality is good (even if soft).

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband & I stayed here last week. The staff were so nice. It was our honeymoon and we were gifted a bottle of free champagne and $100 credit to use on the rooftop bar! This was so generous and we were hugely flattered. The room was so big and stylish! The bathroom was beautiful. The hotel was in a perfect location. So close to Central Park and just around the corner from Times Square and the theatres. It was in a safe area. There was only two points that let the hotel down;1) the housekeeping wasn't the best. The robes in the bathroom were filthy when we arrived and weren't changed all week! - even after calling to get them changed. So we obviously didn't use them. 2) the breakfast is expensive! And it's not worth it. Our coffee was served with curdled milk (it was obvious off). I couldn't take a photo because the team to be honest were mortified and took it off the table straight away. But for nearly $90 for two people it wasn't good. We only had breakfast here once. But overall the hotel was lovely and we would certainly stay again. Definitely a romantic hotel, stylish and really friendly staff!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I spent my friend's bachelorette weekend here. Was treated by professional and friendly staff special mention - Paula Tito. Location is perfect next to the shopping district, Central Park and close to all the fun activities NYC has to offer. The rooms were stylish and boutique. I will definitely recommend this wonderful gem of a hotel!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I make it a habit to check the Marriott website for new acquisitions in the Big Apple. They always have some and if you pay attention to the newcomers they are deeply discounted to introduce them to Marriott customers. Bottom line here is the Meridien had room nights for us under $300 in NYC’s best neighborhood. The hotel is steps away from Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Fifth Avenue luxury and all the best the city has to offer. Saying that, the hotel only had to be fair for it to be a great value. But, it’s a nice old place with some interesting features like custom woodwork around the bedroom built in headboards and elegant, tiled large bathrooms. There are some maintenance and updating issues but the staff we encountered were all uniformly pleasant. I don’t imagine the bargain prices for their rooms will last very long so if location matters to you, this is a deal to jump on.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I traveled to New York City for the Bryant Park Winter Village market 22-24 Nov 2019. We opted not to stay with family at their 8th Ave and 14th St property, but instead made reservations at Le Meridien 57th St Central Park South. I've been a Marriott brand property loyalist for the past 5 years. As a consultant I spend approximately 72% of my time on travel in hotels, and I've come to expect quality service and impeccable accommodations from Marriott. The Le Meridien New York, Central Park property was amazing. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by professional staff eager to welcome us to the property. Check-in was swift and efficient. I've ambassador elite status, and was excited to have received a suite upgrade. I had no idea what was in store for us. As we entered the 27th floor suite, the massive glass windows filled the suite with brilliant sweeping Central Park Autumn foliage views. Setting our bags down, we walked through the rooms to make note of the accommodations. The suite was impressive. The enlarged bedroom also offered panoramic views of Central Park. The bedroom had a wall-mounted television, firm and comfortable mattress, as well as vintage designed features and fixtures. As we walked through the pocket doors into the bathroom foyer, dual sinks recessed into granite countertops finished with charming brass fixtures were to our left, walled off separate walk-in closet and toilet were to our front, and a massive open glass walled shower to our right. The enormous bathroom space was filled with natural light from a raised porthole window. The space allocated to the bathroom area by no means compromised any of the suite's vast living space. Back in the main living space were vintage designed sofa and chairs, stools, tables, and lighting fixtures. The space also featured a workspace, elevated buffet table, and a tailored minibar with complimentary and for purchase-items. The kitchenette featured an enlarged bar sink, Illy coffee maker, and glass door mini-fridge. The mini-fridge was stocked with non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages for purchase. Every detail of the suite was carefully designed to give an eclectic feel but with modern amenities. Taking it all in, we realized we weren't in a hotel, but rather an apartment tailored to provide a fashioned vintage experience. I would be remiss if I didn't comment about "The Roof". It's the Le Meridien's New York City rooftop lounge. It too was impressive with sweeping views of Central Park and the surrounding skyline. It featured outdoor (covered) and indoor lounge areas, comfortable seating, ambience, and was serviced by professional staff and populated with polite patrons. In my opinion and experience staying at Marriott properties, I'd say the Le Meridien 57th St Central Park is my favorite. It is not a cookie cutter property to house guests, but instead offered us an unparalleled quality of life and comfortable experience. I would encourage anyone looking to feel at home in New York City to stay at the Le Meridien 57th St Central Park. My wife and I will return.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: A great “boutique” hotel with all of the detailing of a small bespoke hotel with all of the support and structure of a big chain. The location is perfect - the rooms are great. It was a refreshing change from other midtown tourist traps

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I had read mixed reviews of the hotel, but we could not have enjoyed our stay more! Some of the rooms are small, but the Central park 1bedroom suites are spacious, and true to the pictures. All of the hotel staff were so welcoming to us, particularly the hotel manager Natacha deFrank and the Rooftop bar manager. We had a wonderful stay. Thank you!!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Small rooms, unfriendly staff, expensive, poor breakfast. When you order gin and tonic for $20 per glass you expect some service and hospitality. The small buffet for breakfast is often incomplete. Coffee orders take about 20 minutes to get delivered.The only good thing is that it is close to Central Park

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: If you are staying for more than a week as a couple, upgrade to the suite, which will get you a bar area, living room area and separate bedroom and large bathroom with large closet. We originally were in a single room, and one of us would have to sit on the bed for the other one to find their stuff and get organized and dressed. There are some rooms with Central Park views, but they will not guarantee them when you book. When you arrive from 5 to 6 pm, they give you a glass of decent wine, which is a nice touch.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: the hotel was great. the one-bed room suite was the best with the best view of central park. the staff was perfect at check in and check out. the roof top bar was very cool. I will be back again. this was a great location to be.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: After reading the reviews, I was skeptical but saw a decent last min deal on Living Social. Very pleasantly surprised! It's a Marriott property, which I didn't realize. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Small room but that's typical in NYC. Great location. Nice lobby AND rooftop bar but of course, expensive...it IS NYC. Great location!Definitely recommend and would stay there again if price is right.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed just one night with a group of friends. The hotel is very nice for the price, and front desk staff were very accommodating. The new flagship Nordstrom is just up the street! Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Very nice hotel. The room was clean, the staff were very friendly and professional. However, the temperature of the room was difficult to maintain. The bar was very nice and cozy. Hotel is in a great location. We would stay there again—if the temperature could be better regulated.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: The room was clean, spacious, and had an amazing view of Central Park. The lobby was warm and welcoming, with a friendly and helpful staff. Special thanks to Felitta who took great care of us! I highly recommend this hotel for any business or pleasure trips to the city. Great location near Central Park.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Not much I can offer as a positive with this one. The staff were nice, most competent and friendly , but there were the ones who weren’t. The rooms are very old and tired, desperately needing an upgrade. The roof top bar is ok, but not enough to compensate for this very old and tired hotel. My recommendation is stay somewhere else.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: My family loved this hotel when we stayed last year while it was still under the Viceroy banner, so when I signed up to run the New York Marathon this year, we booked a suite early to ensure we all had room (especially when I got up at 4am to stretch!). When we arrived and found a new hotel brand name on the door I joked to my wife, “I assume they transferred the reservation...”. I shouldn’t have joked. When Melissa at the front desk furrowed her brow at her screen, I knew what was coming: “It appears your reservation was canceled out of the system.” After first declining to be squeezed into a double-double, I pressed for two rooms to make up for the error. Thankfully, Melissa and the hotel were able to accommodate me, and they honored the original price. Melissa was calm and helpful, and the manager stepped in to ensure everything was copacetic. The hotel staff went out of their way to make sure the many marathoners on property felt encouraged and welcomed, which was nice. The only downside we found during our two night stay was the buffet breakfast at Kingside, the onsite restaurant. It was anemic: a couple of trays of pastries and bagels, a picked-over bowl of fruit (with those little fruit gnats buzzing around it) and a near empty at 8am chafing dish with standard eggs, potatoes, sausage, and bacon. Nothing fancy or special - and entirely adequate for a reasonable price. $30 per person is not a reasonable price for scrambled eggs and potatoes, even in NYC. Until they up the breakfast game, pick one of the several restaurants in easy walking distance. Overall a good experience, and the staff (especially Melissa at the desk) was great.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: After shoveling from one room to another, , got a nice room. Front desk attendants attentive and Helpful. Restaurant very substandard. Breakfast service essentially non existence. Lobby remodeled but rest of hotel old and tired— needs modernization

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: walking distance to central park and 5th ave shopping. front desk staff were all very friendly, professional and very helpful. (concierge not so much). they give you unlimited bottles of water and a fridge. shower stall is arranged a bit strange-can easily get flooded as it's not completely covered. but the staff was extra good.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is so so central. The staff so so helpful and polite. Cleanliness in the room was very evident. The room was also very quiet—a big plus in a big city. The staff provided a glass of wine to all the weary shoppers upon return in the evening. Nice surprise!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I chose the Le Meridien when it was the Viceroy as the hotel I would stay at and get ready on my wedding day. I picked it for a couple of reasons but mostly because of the decor and fantastic views of Central Park. When the property was bought out by the Marriott and became the Le Meridien, they transitioned everything over seamlessly and honored our reservations, as well as the hotel block and group rate. When I had toured the property as the Viceroy, I was shown the rooftop bar and deck which has amazing views of Central Park. I really wanted photos on our wedding day from here capturing the city. I later found out that the rooftop is separately owned/operated and I received a little bit of a hard time gaining access for photos. The staff at the Le Meridien still made sure my request was taken care of and organized roof access for me to have photos taken up there (Thank you Tyler!). The front desk employees were incredibly nice, friendly, helpful and accommodating. Overall, everyone at the hotel really did everything to make sure I was taken care of on our special day. We also ate at the Kingside restaurant in the lobby. We were pleasantly surprised at how delicious the food was. I stayed in the penthouse suite which was insanely gorgeous. Probably the nicest hotel room I have ever been in. I did have family and friends in king and double rooms, which were also nice for a standard room. Yes the rooms are on the smaller side, but welcome to New York. Everything in New York is on the smaller side. You're not going to find sprawling rooms anywhere in the city unless you pay for the penthouse. I definitely recommend this property!!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed in this hotel several times in the summer and fall 2019 seasons. Amazing location on 57th Street in the heart of 'Billionaire's Row', received standard Marriott benefits, and the front desk staff are very helpful. However, that is where the plus points of this hotel end... the rooms require modernisation - my room was covered in pen marks and scratches - my telephone didn't work, toiletries were not replenished and it takes forever to get an elevator during peak hours. I appreciate that this hotel has recently been taken over by Marriott, but it will require significant investment to reach a suitable Marriott / Meridien standard. Given there are so many fabulous hotel choices in New York I would not choose to stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: stayed here with my family for a long weekend. We walked everywhere!! Hotel is in a great central location, close to Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Columbus Square and Time Square. The rooms were spacious and the view was great.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for a long weekend. Staff was extremely helpful, especially Sonam at the front desk. Rooms are spacious for NYC and the property was well maintained. The decor is up to date and the shower was wonderful.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Good central position a stones throw from Carnegie Hall. I liked the french style decor and helpful staff but the jewel in the crown is the rooftop bar (30th floor) with great views over central park.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Once upon a time there was a grand hotel called the Parker Meridien which fronted on two streets, 57th and 56th, and when we reserved here we thought that this was the successor to the Parker Meriden. Come to find out, a few years ago the hotel was divided in the middle of the two blocks, with the 57th street part of it becoming Le Meridien, a Marriott hotel, and the 56th St part of it becoming the Parker Hotel, a Hyatt property. Must be that all the good rooms ended in the Parker Hotel, because from our own experience (and the other reviews posted on Tripadvorr) I would venture that there are no good rooms on the Le Meridien side of the former Parker Meridien. Now we paid using Marriott points, but when I checked the price on the web for Saturday,Oct 12, it was a little over $600, and if I had paid that for this little enclosure with poor water pressure, I might have ended up jail. Next time we'll try the Parker, so check back for my posts in a few months for a comparison. The plus-es: Terrific location, half a block from Carnegie Hall, and a very nice staff.A big negative: No business center or computers available to guests.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently stayed here for a celebration weekend and our amazing experience began days before we arrived. I reached out to the property to pre-arrange a few things as we were spending the long weekend celebrating both my son’s 1st anniversary and my 50th birthday. Front desk mgr, Kyle Kitchen immediately took responsibility to ensure we had the best possible experience and he did not disappoint! From the moment we arrived, I knew we’d made the right choice. We were greeted warmly and professionally and acknowledged for both my Bonvoy status and our special events. My hubby and I enjoyed outstanding cocktails and snacks at the bar while waiting for my son and daughter in law to arrive. Our Central Park suites were incredible, nicely appointed with great attention to detail. I love that they’ve kept the historic feel without letting things get run down. Every single person we interacted with during our stay was friendly and professional. We will definitely visit this property again. If you’ve seen some of the questionable reviews from recent months, please know these were probably just from the growing pains of the recent ownership change. I feel they’ve worked through that transition and the current mgmt has gotten things going the right direction.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: During a three-day stay, I fell in love with this hotel. It's beautiful, comfortable, conveniently located — and the service is impeccable. I would most definitely stay here again.We booked through Hotwire and got an incredible rate ($147 per night) for a "European-style cozy king." The room did not feel cramped (unlike the rooms at the nearby Paramount), we easily found a place for everything, and the bed was indeed a king. The room had attractive design elements (unlike the bland rooms at the Parker, next-door), and the bathroom had a lot of classic style. We were delighted to find upscale Malin + Goetz toiletries in the bathroom, and we took advantage of the hotel's policy of providing guests with free Aquafina bottled water on demand. We found the hotel's staff friendly and very helpful, especially the doormen. When I returned to the hotel one morning with coffee in one hand and groceries in the other, a doorman not only held the door but also followed me to the elevator and punched the button for my floor.I'm utterly baffled by the negative reviews for this hotel. It's one of the best I've encountered in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: First time coming back since it changed into a Le Meridien. I used to come all the time when it was Viceroy. While I do miss the slippers they used to provide, in all honesty - it's an environmental waste for people to wear slippers for a few days and then the hotel throws them away. Sibi from Housekeeping really impressed me. My room had no snacks like the bar had 3 drinks in it and there were no snacks in the tray. He brought me some and then came back the next night to ensure I didn't need any water or additional snacks. What service - this guy deserves some acknowledgement. I haven't had anyone follow up like that at any hotel ever. I made the mistake of going to the Parker next door on my last trip... which is awful. The room felt so outdated and not in a cool, hip way. Location is a few doors down from a 24/7 grocery store and Duane Reed on the corner. I also really love the food at the connected restaurant - the S&P fries are dangerously good!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located a few steps from Central Park and minutes from a subway station. The staff is great! Shout out to the hotel manager Shahram, all of our needs were taken care of immediately and we even got delicious macaroons in our room to enjoy. The staff had awesome recommendations for food and shopping. The service was top notch, lobby is recently renovated and the room was comfy! We had a minor issue with the bathroom fan and it was resolved within minutes. I will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I was excited to book this supposedly new hotel at a great rate. Only to find that the hotel is old but under new management and is in dire need of updates. The rooms are really old and not well maintained. But the thing that ruined my stay completely was the constant knocking even when I had a privacy sign on the door. They had assumed I was checking out even though I explained to them I had booked a reservation for one more day and the Front Desk had stated I would be staying in the same room.The housekeeping supervisor or Manager came back and demanded I go to the Front Desk to clarify since his board doesn't state so. I had explained to him that I had not slept in 36 hours and I was going for a meeting in 3 hours so I have no time to go and wait in line to clarify. I asked him to either call the Front Desk or head on down to ask them. He walked away and I went to bed. He was back again banging at my door, even with the privacy sign. I would not recommend this hotel. At least until they do better.
user_name:
Mercy O
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Our anniversary stay and Julia was so nice and considerate that we were upgraded to a very nice room. She was very patient and with amazing and caring attitude. Thank you so much for everything! We really loved it!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in September 2019, there was a small issue upon arrival. We booked a junior suite but later after booking upgraded to a park suite, during the recent ownership change this had been overlooked, thus a small issue upon arrival. Sonam on the desk was fantastic, we went through my booking and whilst the room we booked was not available for the first night a very amicable resolution was found. When we had to move rooms the next day, this was all done on our behalf whilst we were out enjoying ourselves. Muntari was outstanding moving the cases, re hanging our jackets and ensuring that everything we had was correctly moved.I really hope the management pas on these comments to these guys, these guys have made the Meridien our first choice hotel in NYC.Thanks for the hospitality, the amenities and adding to our holiday

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I wish and wanted to write this hotel a better review but I just can’t. While the service and staff are top notch, the hotel needs help. The lobby and rooftop are beautiful and everyone at the front desk was lovely. The issue is the rooms need serious updating and housekeeping needs to be properly trained on cleaning rooms. The room was on a top floor and had great views however, the room was dusty. We had a mini bar that was not stocked, light bulbs missing, a shower that didn’t drain well, fixtures that needed updating and the list goes on. While the bed was very comfortable and sheets lovely it was just poorly cared for. In time and with updates the hotel will be fantastic but for now, the price truly doesn’t match the room. We are Marriott Gold and Amex Platinum members so I know we did get an ‘upgrade’ and had some nice amenities added but it just didn’t take away from the room quality.
user_name:
JoannaN207
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Hotel may be better in a year but I can’t recommend it to anyone despite the nice and pleasant staff. Rooms are tired and banged up - think heavy banged up wood from the 1970: Gym is closed “for renovation” but it’s gutted so don’t go anytime soon if that’s important. The kicker. Invited friends over to its celebrated rooftop bar for drinks in hopes of salvaging stay. But no. It was closed for a “private function.”Many better options in this neighborhood. I hope they fix all the physical plant problems as the staff was nice.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for the first time. It was beautifully decorated, amazing location and super clean and comfortable. They had everything I needed for my stay and a beautiful roof top bar. Great place.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Pros: The bed was comfortable, sheets were clean and the bathroom shower was roomy with good spray. Cons: Our room was the smallest hotel room that I have ever stayed in. The window had no sheers just heavy, depressing huge dark brown drapery. So, we could either have no exterior light or reveal ourselves to the guests of another hotel whose rooms we could see into. Furniture was minimal and worn. The A/C system was within a foot of the bed - noisy and humid. The hotel restaurant, Kingside, had tasteless food and inattentive service. Only 2 bath towels and one robe were in the room. Our first request for additional towels went unheeded; we then got the towels upon 2nd request. No complimentary toiletries (shower cap, Q-tips, make-up pads) were in the room and there was only 1 small bar of soap provided. The closet was tiny with peeling wallpaper. No dresser or drawers because there was no room. This is not a 4-star hotel.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I have stayed at many Le Meridien hotels and this one was disappointing. Rooms were small and dark and were dated despite being remodeled. Several bulbs were out in my room and I had to call down to have soap delivered. The downstairs restaurant was decent. The lack of a club lounge was also a disappointment.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for a biz trip. The hotel is in a good location if you need up and downtown lines. Room was ok, pretty standard. Drain in bathroom seemed clogged, which was a little gross. Doorman Raphael helped me out a ton, he is the man. Great service!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Love this hotel! It’s beautiful, clean and close to everything. The staff was wonderful, specially Mirian Ortega who hooked us up with the Jr Suite with a great view. Will definitely go back and refer to friends and family!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Staff was very pleasant and the room was comfortable. However, my door lock did not work and the mini fridge was not fully stocked. Even with those two issues I still enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Location is great. Staff was helpful. Disappointed with the room.1. Rooms are small. Bed is 15” high. Too low for people who have had back, hip, or knee surgeries unless they’re under 5’. Asked for accessible room and none were available for our stay. We were told they also had low beds. 2. Makeup mirror in bathroom could not be tilted. You have to be 6’ to see your reflection. No counter space in bathroom or room. 3. Espresso machine with lukewarm water versus coffee pot4. Lights dim/yellow hue4. Lounge bar on ground floor and roof top bar standing room only. Half the seats were reserved for parties. Not a place to relax and enjoy a drink.5. No business center. Had to give a thumb drive to Concierge to print e-check for mobile deposit. Thought about changing our reservation after the first night but decided to stick it out for two more nights.At least the place was clean minus the robe hanging in the bathroom with a stain on it.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We have had great luck in the past with all Marriott Brands. This hotel has a great location for what we need. The hotel itself seems dingy and has a high humidity in the rooms and common areas. The staff at the front counter are friendly, except for one of the front desk managers (John) who was less than friendly or helpful with a booking problem. The rooms are okay, but we had no robes so we ordered two. They did not show up until the next day when we told the clerk at the front desk. For $400.00 per night you would expect to have more than 2 towels for two guest. The bed does not have a box spring, just a mattress on the Art Deco platform. They provide a Illy coffee espresso machine but only two pods. The lobby area is dirty looking (not a good first impression) the rooms are average and IMHO are priced up there with many “fine” hotels.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Le Meridien for a weekend of Broadway shows. Location was the best feature, with convenient access to multiple subway stations and also Central Park. Doorman Raphael was very attentive, and made our stay even more comfortable.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: The rooms were not maintained well. AC was not working. Technician had to be called at 2:30 AM to fix it. The phone handset was not working and had to use the speaker function. Housekeeping took over 30 mins to deliver a dental kit. Manager was responsive after checkout and offered a partial credit of points for essentially a really lousy stay. They ought to have refunded the entire stay or offered another night

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Nice hotel for the location to central park. I have been in much nicer Le Meridien hotels and this one was more basic to me. Rooms were nice and clean. Lobby small and almost no lobby actually. The restaurant is not actually part of the hotel but nice and good breakfast.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed at the Le Meridien on a recent summer weekend. I appreciated the location close to Central Park and the F 57th Street train stop. The Shops at Columbus Circle are also nearby. I received a rare Titanium upgrade to a high floor with a park view. Room was tiny but functional and well appointed. Checked out the rooftop bar. Was palatable early in the evening but descended into DJ din for the mostly Millennial clientele as the night wore on. Nice park views. Even though I scored an outstanding AAA rate of $205/night, I can’t give the property five stars. The connecting doors between rooms presented challenges for sleeping late or turning in early. Small children’s voices and their parents’ cackles could be heard from the suite next door. Almost called the front desk when a guest in the same suite decided to kick the connecting door for no reason. The sink and shower stall did not drain properly. The interior corridors were dark and depressing. The HVAC system cycled on and off so frequently that I had to completely turn it off. May stay here again but will more likely check out some other Marriott family properties in the area.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: We actually stayed here when it was still the Viceroy so the rooms may have changed since, but when we were there the rooms were really cool and really comfortable. The best thing though was the location, literally like 5 mins (less than) from Bergdorfs and Central Park. We occasionally got a yellow cab / the subway but mostly walked everywhere because it really wasn't far at all. Recommend for location alone, but as I say the room was also beaut, so win-win.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: What great room—nice layout, that was comfortable despite the efficient size. However, my room had a thick heavy smell of smoke. I was quickly transferred to another room, but it too had an odor. The next day I upgraded to a suite; maybe things would be better in a more expensive room. Disappointingly, it was not. Again, the accoutrements were distinctive and the room comfortably furnished. But there were little flying bugs in the washroom (which sometimes flew into the main room). When taking a shower, I found myself in increasingly high standing water: the drain in the shower did not work. How did the cleaning staff miss that (didn’t they clean the shower)? Some of the things could have easily been caught by hotel staff (smoke smell, clogged shower drain). I’m surprised that a hotel of this caliber came up short on so many things. The service was polite and responsive, but I waited over an hour to shower after a long day, and then had to hope there were too many of those insects in the room. Needless to say, I didn’t have a restful night’s sleep.
user_name:
Al M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I booked the hotel thinking I was returning to Le Meridien Parker but discovered that the Parker is now a Hyatt and Le Meridien moved next door into what was a boutique property. All I can say is yuck. ...well I guess I can say more. The rooms are insanely small and dark. I think they are trying to go for a nautical theme perhaps because the rooms are like a tiny stateroom. The bathroom was awful. The sink was falling off the wall - not kidding. Could not set my toothbrush on it because it would slide off onto the floor. There is no lobby to speak of. And I could hear everything going on in the drab hallway. I’ve learned my lesson. ...and this reinforces my view that Marriott has no idea what to do with this brand. This property is worse than a Four Points.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I was unaware this was a takeover of another hotel. Yet they made no changes. rooms were dark/small, furniture was worn/weathered and utter lack of convenient power outlets to charge devices in this day and age.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: This is my second time staying here for business, but the first time since the renovations. The hotel was as expected, small but chic and efficient rooms.The staff was warm and helpful, and I especially want to recognize Ricardo, who went above and beyond in his effort to find me a taxi close to 5 pm, even carrying my bag and directing me to the appropriate cross street to hail one. It is kindness and details like this which build customer loyalty. Thank you!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: If you look for a well located hotel go there.Rooms are poor but clean.Service quite poor, from office ok, concierge ko.Restaurant ko, unprofessional Luck of quality .Perfect to sleep but do not requir3 anything else.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Everyone was incredibly welcoming and hospitable. The front desk agent who checked me in went out of her way to connect and build a personal connection with me. The bellman were incredibly helpful with directions and suggestions for the area. We ordered room service late night and the gentleman who brought up our chocolate cake was so sweet and kind!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Absolutely terrible, as a lifetime plat / titanium I am still waiting for the refunds of the internet charges after several emails and voicemails and promises of credits still notta. The Hotel and Marriott customer service are less than subpar. Hotel bed is 4 inches off the ground and super uncomfortable, rooms are super tiny. Super dated and tiny. Prior to arriving called to inquire about the breakfast/lounge access was misinformed via phone and in person. Would have stayed in a different hotel if accurate info was provided. I do not recommend this hotel and Marriott should be ashamed to have taken over and not provided appropriate training. Spirit to serve has been removed all together and the executive office / customer service was not helpful in resolving issue either. I guess it’s time to leave the Marriott family.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: The staff were amazing!My room looked and was from the 70’s. The brass fixtures had no shine, and fell off when I went t to sh shower, it was clean, quiet and other than the roof top view not worth the $$.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Only had a couple dollars cash on me when leaving for the airport but Raphael insisted on helping me, claiming he doesn’t care about the money, he just enjoys helping good people. Nice hotel too, wish I had a better view, but good deal.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I’m kind of shocked how this hotel service wise doesn’t have it together. There were constant issues. Everything from check in to room service / housekeeping to the overall quality with the staff. Not sure if they were overwhelmed but it does need attention. Room overall is decent and the location otherwise is amazing. Food at their restaurant was fine too. I’d have given this a 4 star had it not been due to the service.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is not very big, but is very welcoming and clean. Upon our arrival we were told that we could valet park our car for a fee of $75 per night with no re entry privileges, that means that every time you use your car you pay additional $75. Nobody told us that we could self park at the same (close) garage for a lower amount. Aside from that, our stay was very comfortable, and I would highly recommend it also for families and small groups. Rooms come with a mini fridge, 1 free bottle of water daily and complimentary espresso machine with pods. Exercise room and rooftop bar are easily accessible.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is located in a great area. Close to Fifth Ave, Central Park, and Times Square. It is far enough away to be relaxing and away from the craziness. The rooms were nice as was the hotel itself.The staff was great. The doorman Raphael stood out in particular. He was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a place to stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I used to love the Parker Méridien. This property now branded as Le Meridien wasn’t up to par. Very small rooms ( even by nyc standards) that we’re tired and needed an update. Best thing here is the rooftop bar.
user_name:
PW11803
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is very old and has many issues, but if you get a room on the top floors you'll have a great view in an amazing location.The issues:Flickering lights (sometimes bright, most of the time dim)Old, slow elevators (waiting 5-8 min for one to arrive)Terrible ventilation (just... trust me, no fan in the bathroom!)The service:The front desk had an issue (not their fault) where they lost a reservation for some of our group members so some of us had rooms and others did not.The bad part was that they refused to give a room to the group members that didn't have rooms despite us showing the confirmation email.Eventually, after telling us they had 0 rooms available, they provided our group with rooms.Further, I asked for a complimentary upgrade as a Gold Member and I was spoken to as if I was dumb for asking. They did end up placing me on a higher floor after the fact, which was odd because I didn't follow up or push it at all. Maybe a change of heart?This is def not one of the better Meridiens, that's for sure. It reminded me of a motel 6 with a great location. Some coworkers stayed in the W (similar brand, also Bonvoy) and had 0 complaints.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: The doorman Raphael was a legend. Super helpful. Room was NYC size but definitely comfortable and well equipped. All staff very friendly and courteous. That’s all I want to say- why does trip advisor make us use 200 characters minimum?

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at Le Meridien for three weeks, and I miss it. The staff was friendly, and the location was incredible. Only a few steps from Central park, and pretty much everything else. Even a nice 24 hour grocery store only 20 ft away that has everything you could imagine. The hotel also has one the most popular rooftop bars in NYC, with incredible views of Central Park. They had a DJ for the people inside most nights, but still had an option to relax and drink in the open air rooftop portion as well. The hotel restaurant is also a real hot spot, with great food and service. The hostess even remembered that I had a little three year old back home and wished me a happy fathers day when I came down for dinner. A couple of nights, the restaurant held some blockbuster movie premiers. One was for "The Dead Don't Die' movie and I got to run into Selena Gomez and a couple others. The rooms are very unique and upscale regal feel. My room had wood floor, brass fittings, walk-in marble tile shower, and the coolest bathroom mirror I've seen in a hotel (a second mirror is on a bracket and swings around to view all angles). Since converting from Viceroy, they also have a new sales staff that's top notch. I met Mirian, the new Director of Sales, and I could tell she really cares for the hotel and puts in a lot of effort into making the events, and guests, feel as welcome as possible. I would see in the lobby some mornings greeting all the guests coming and going. The housekeepers were also some of the best I've experienced. The GM is quite a character too. With the new staff, the Le Meridien flag, and the Marriott brand backing them, this hotel is a no brainer. Again, I miss it and hope to go back sometime.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I have only great things to say about this hotel! The location is so close to everything and the Central Park and city views are perfection. The staff is very attentive and always available. The hotel has all the amenities I could ask for. Check out Kingside restaurant downstairs and of course The Roof rooftop bar, little pricey but all the drinks in NYC are - and it is worth this view!

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: Had a one night stay and the team provided seamless unobtrusive service. The arrival experience was 1-2-3 and the hotel's GM Shahram gave a courtesy call to ensure everything was to satisfaction. The amazing view of Central Park from the rooftop bar is the perfect backdrop. I'll be back.

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: I am an avid business traveller and stay about 50 days a year in hotel rooms. The stay in Le Merridian was the worst experience with the hotel misplacing 8 pieces of my expensive shirts/ trousers/ t shirt which I had given for laundry. The response of the hotel staff was very disgusting to say the least as they lacked both accountability and responsiveness. The staff changed the narrative multiple times and what was promised to be delivered in 24 hours is yet to be found after 72 hours. As someone who is on a road show and travelling to multiple cities in the next 10 days, the behaviour by the hotel has put me in quite a distress. Sincere advice, avoid staying in this hotel if you are looking for a decent experience

hotel_name: Le Meridien New York, Central Park
review_body: OK, so we like some others booked this hotel thinking that the former Parker Meridien had returned to the Meridien fold. Nope - that hotel, now known as the Parker New York, is now in the Hyatt family and confusingly is right next door to the "new" Le Meridien New York, formerly the Viceroy. (I should have known the price was too good to be true for that hotel.)Now for the good part - we received a small upgrade to a room with a terrace, a low floor so no park view, but any NYC view is kind of fun. The room was "cozy" as booked, clean with new carpet, full of slightly worn but interesting art Deco wood furnishings and tiled bathroom, both of which add character and I hope are to be refreshed but not replaced. (Dear hotel - consider some leather mats to cover the scuffed end table and desk.). Air conditioning looked new, and worked great. Reception (VJ especially)was friendly, helpful, and extended our check out an hour to have breakfast. (Kingside was fine for breakfast, and also check out the roof bar for its views, although it might be crowded.)Some nits - found an empty a water bottle on the terrace. Used the app to try to get more towels and got no response after 2 hours, but a call was answered and towels delivered promptly. So, not the hotel we expected, but warm, courteous, clean if a bit worn, and right now at a price point tough to match in this neighborhood.
user_name:
M9876789
New York City, New York
